page.title: 07History (4)
page.content: In 1801 the population of Wenhaston was 578, growing to 1,094 by 1841 and falling to 786 in 1891. Thorington and Bramfield populations followed similar patterns of rise and fall, but their total population was only 410 in 1891. The major occupations were concerned with the land and horses. More than half of the adult males were farm workers of some sort. More than half of the remainder were concerned with transport, carters, waggoners etc.. The remaining 25% were evenly divided between various trades; saddlers and harness makers, shoemakers, blacksmith etc.
